VirtualFile.Name: Config.WTF
VirtualFile.Description: Config.WTF stores your last Battle.net and World of Warcraft account names, last realm and characters played, as well as video, sound and other settings. This Virtual File allows different Config.WTF files per Character.

WindowLayout.Name: Team Dethro
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features maximum usage of a single monitor. Swapping enabled. Does not include a home for every window. Leaves space for the Windows taskbar.

WindowLayout.Name: Team2
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

WindowLayout.Name: Team GoMe
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

WindowLayout.Name: Team SuperTramp
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

RepeaterProfile.Name: Default
RepeaterProfile.Description:
It is not recommended to change the Startup defaults of the generated Repeater Profile, or to set Hotkeys in it. For best results, assign a hotkey through the Control Key Map instead.
When using the Quick Setup, you should rarely need to use Repeater. See the WoW Quick Start Guide at http://isboxer.com/index.php/guides/69-wow-guide-quick-start for information on Repeater and easily setting up all of the broadcasting keys that you need.

MappedKey.Name: Melee IWT
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Casters Strafe Left
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Casters Up
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.

Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

KeyMap.Name: General
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended for general and non-combat use, things that can usually be used by all of your Character Sets.

MappedKey.Name: Dance With My Target
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that assists and performs a WoW Macro, such as /dance. Similar macros can be used for achievements, e.g. /love (critters) and /hug (pvp).

MappedKey.Name: FTL Assist Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Assist Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the FTL DPS Keys map. You can also use this as a manual assist Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /assist macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to assist you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Follow Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Follow Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the Control map. You can also use this as a manual follow Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /follow macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to follow you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Target Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Target Me" key. It does not have a Hotkey by default, nor is it used by other maps by default.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /target macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to target you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Keep CTM
MappedKey.Description:
Same as the other Interact with Target, except this one does not automatically disable Click to Move afterward.
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Invite Others
MappedKey.Description: Invites other Characters in your Character Set to group. If you have linked Character Sets together with Also Launch, you may want to adjust the macro to /invite additional characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others Jump
MappedKey.Description: Makes your other characters jump.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing
MappedKey.Description: Turns Jamba Follow Strobing on or off

MappedKey.Name: Flying V Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Flying V aligns your characters in a V behind the leader. This example mapping always aligns them behind the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 total characters.

MappedKey.Name: Line Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Line formation aligns your characters in a line to the left and right of the leader. This example mapping always aligns them next to the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). This example mapping always aligns them around the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Right
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

KeyMap.Name: Control
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended to always be on, which means that all of the hotkeys are in use even if you turn off Key Maps in-game. It contains the toggles for the other Key Maps and Repeater, as well as various mappings used by other features.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Maps
MappedKey.Description:
This toggles Key Maps. It is used by, and updates, the "A,A" icon that shows up by default in the upper left corner in game (a button in the Click Bar called Broadcast).
If you create your own Key Maps (as opposed to adding Mapped Keys to the current Key Maps), you will need to add a Key Map State Action to steps 1 and 2 of this key if you want to toggle your new Key Map. Additionally, if you have different Key Maps per Character Set, you may want to black list any conflicting Key Maps through your Character Set. (Select your Character Set in the top pane, then "Key Maps" in the bottom left pane.)

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move Off
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move off. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move On
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move on. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Follow
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaMaster key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, the JambaMaster and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This tells the Jamba Addon to tell the other characters the current one is master.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe Off
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn off follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe On
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn on follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Next window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the next window (in Slot order). Just set a Hotkey above, and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Previous window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the previous window (in Slot order). Just set a Hotkey above, and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Broadcast Click Bar
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Broadcast Click Bar

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Formations Click Bar
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Formations Click Bar

MappedKey.Name: Copy of Next window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the next window (in Slot order). Just set a Hotkey above, and Export.

KeyMap.Name: FTL DPS Keys
KeyMap.Description:
This is the generated combat oriented Key Map. It was automatically filled with the default Action Bar hotkeys (1 through =). Each of the Mapped Keys will auto-assist and broadcast.
If you need more keys like this, the Many New Mapped Keys option from the right-click menu on Mapped Keys will help you set them up very quickly. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Quickly_add_many_hotkeys.2C_optionally_with_auto-assist.

MappedKey.Name: DPS 1
MappedKey.Description:
If you press 1 with Key Maps turned on, this Mapped Key will have each of your toons assist you and press 1.
If you need more keys like this, the Many New Mapped Keys option from the right-click menu on Mapped Keys will help you set them up very quickly. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Quickly_add_many_hotkeys.2C_optionally_with_auto-assist.

MappedKey.Name: Example round-robin
MappedKey.Description: This is a simple example of a round-robin hotkey. It sends "2" to each of 5 windows, one at a time, each time you press the hotkey. To try it out, just set the Hotkey above (to something other than 2, since that is used by DPS 2), and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Example targeted AOE
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that will pass the next mouse click to the other windows, after sending "7". To try it out, just set the Hotkey above (to something other than 7, since that is used by DPS 7), and Export. When you press the Hotkey, mouse broadcasting is temporarily enabled to send the click to the desired windows, until you click!

WoWMacroSet.Name: Quick Setup 38
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 38

WoWMacro.Name: SlashDance
WoWMacro.Description: Just dance.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLAssist
WoWMacro.Description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLTarget
WoWMacro.Description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: InviteTeam
WoWMacro.Description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOn
WoWMacro.Description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOff
WoWMacro.Description: Disables Click-to-Move

WoWMacro.Name: JambaMaster
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOn
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOff
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.
Reloads the WoW interface. This will activate any ISBoxer WoW Macro changes made (after an Export while playing).

WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description:
Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.
/cleartarget [noharm] /cleartarget [dead]
These have some value though. Put them in your /follow macro. Why?
There are many NPC's and mobs in the world that are straight bugged the F out when it comes to following on your mount.
I have /assist in my /follow macro for when I need melee combat. If one of my alts is targeting one of the bugged NPCs or dead bodies, and I mount of and hit /follow macro (to ensure they are all following) it will randomly cause that player to dismount. Reason being is that it tires to /assist (attack) the current target and dismounts.
The fix would be to remove /assist from my follow macro, but it makes multibox melee combat pretty simple the way I do it. ;)My solution to that is that I put a "/follow focus" at the end of all my melee ability macros. Lets me keep my main follow button clean.
Activates the Disenchant Ability on only the enchanter in the group

WoWMacro.Description:
http://www.dual-boxing.com/threads/45994-Combat-Sensitive-Mount-Macro
/run if not UnitAffectingCombat("player") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party1") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party2") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party3") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party4") then CallCompanion("MOUNT",1) end
Now that I've started up boxing again with (a new) Team Teht, I've decided to dedicate all my time to making my multibox setup as smooth and streamlined as I can, and then level with the extra time. If a key map isn't working or I feel like I could increase my team's flexibility with more configuration work, I stop what I'm doing and work on it. When I'm satisfied, I go back to what I was doing.
Yesterday, I got my mounts; I decided immediately "I don't like the way they mount." The reason is, different characters are getting out of combat at different times, so it's a pain in the butt to get them all mounted. I decided "There's got to be a way to make this work better" so I broke out the API listings and started browsing. Below is what I came up with:
Code: /run if not UnitAffectingCombat("player") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party1") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party2") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party3") and not UnitAffectingCombat("party4") then CallCompanion("MOUNT",1) end /run if UnitIsPVP("player") then CallCompanion("MOUNT",1) end The above macro checks every member of your party to determine if they are in combat, and mounts the first mount in your mounts window if not. If you want a different mount, you'd have to specify a different number in the CallCompanion call. Also note: The "UnitAffectingCombat" function does not evaluate to true if a character has drawn proximity agro from an NPC - it will only evaluate true after the character has been hit by the NPC or performed an action on the NPC. However, I still find it to work nearly flawlessly, because the function is very reliable at determining when a unit leaves combat. Now I can just spam the key after combat and know that when I do see them mounting, there's not going to be one left without a mount when the cast completes.
Update: I added a line to turn this into a regular mount macro when your character is pvp flagged. This means you'll be able to mount regardless when you're in a BG, where you won't always be in a party together with your team, and you may want to mount anyways to go collect one of your team from a different graveyard or something.

WoWMacro.Description:
http://protjack.hubpages.com/hub/Paladin-aoe How to paladin aoe grind: Here's how I do it, and I love it! This is just so much fun, I don't ever get bored with it! I'm a protection paladin. My items are nothing special - greens and blues. I'm currently near level 63. You can simultaneously deal with five mobs your level easily or an insane number of lower level mobs. Probably much more than twenty mobs in Scarlet Monastery is usual for me and the wow gold you get from items you get there etc. is nice.
You should get a lot of stamina, intellect and strength (stamina for durability, intellect for a big enough mana pool for spells you will be using, strength for improved blocking and increased damage) - if you ask me how much of each, my personal preference is to have amount of each in the order listed (the most stamina, than intellect and than strength) You should get a good shield with mithril spikes or spikes that are according to your level (this is crucial because it deals damage to mobs that attack you) Put on your retribution aura (dealing damage to everybody who attacks you all the time they're attacking) Put blessing of sanctuary on you (you take less damage and deal damage each time you block a hit) Stay on your mount and pull mobs - experiment with the number to see what you can handle Stop and start fighting You can use seal of wisdom to continue regaining mana, or seal of light to regain health while you fight and other seals to suite your playstyle Use consecration to do aoe damage as much as your mana pool allows you to Use any other spells/items - experiment and have fun!
http://multiboxing.com/forums/f4/macro-spells-you-need-aim-click-3593.html

WoWMacro.Description: Stackable Totems Guide This information is gathered from Boom over at Twenty Totems. Multiboxing with all Shammies is fun. Period. Why? Because Shammies get so many cool tools and toys, meant to buff a group of other classes. So when you stack those buffs with muiltiple Shaman, it gets really fun. (not to mention cool to see!) Earth Totems Earthbind Totem - Does not stack. Stoneskin Totem - Does not stack. Stoneclaw Totem - Stacks! Multiple totems does wonders for CC. Strength of Earth Totem - Does not stack. Tremor Totem - Stacks! Dropping these in a staggered fashion will make your group nearly unfearable. Earth Elemental Totem - Stacks! Not really a "stack", but 5 x Tanking Elemental = Awesome. Fire Totems Searing Totem - Stacks! Each does its own damage. They have a mind of their own. Fire Nova Totem - Stacks! Same as the Searing Totem. Drop 5x of these to ward off melee. Magma Totem - Stacks! Same as the 2 above. Frost Resistance Totem - Does not stack. Flametongue Totem - Does not stack. Totem of Wrath - Stacks! +15% crit and +15% hit total. No need to spend talents on hit, or gear. Fire Elemental Totem - Stacks! Just like the Earth elemental, but 5x DPS pets. Water Totems Healing Stream Totem - Stacks! Mana Spring Totem - Does not stack. Poison Cleansing Totem - Stacks! Just like tremor totem, stagger the timing of these. Disease Cleansing Totem - Stacks! Same as Poison. Mana Tide Totem - Stacks! Fire Resistance Totem - Does not stack. Air Totems Grace of Air Totem - Does not stack. Windfury Totem - Does not stack. Grounding Totem - Stacks! Caster mobs = ezmode Windwall Totem - Does not stack. Sentry Totem - Utility Totem - You can place them at different positions to watch over a flag in pvp. Nature Resistance Totem - Does not stack. Tranquil Air Totem - Does not stack. Wrath of Air Totem - Does not stack.

No need to spend talents on hit, or gear. Fire Elemental Totem - Stacks! Just like the Earth elemental, but 5x DPS pets. Water Totems Healing Stream Totem - Stacks! Mana Spring Totem - Does not stack. Poison Cleansing Totem - Stacks! Just like tremor totem, stagger the timing of these. Disease Cleansing Totem - Stacks! Same as Poison. Mana Tide Totem - Stacks! Fire Resistance Totem - Does not stack. Air Totems Grace of Air Totem - Does not stack. Windfury Totem - Does not stack. Grounding Totem - Stacks! Caster mobs = ezmode Windwall Totem - Does not stack. Sentry Totem - Utility Totem - You can place them at different positions to watch over a flag in pvp. Nature Resistance Totem - Does not stack. Tranquil Air Totem - Does not stack. Wrath of Air Totem - Does not stack.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Forward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character forward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Backward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character backward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character counter-clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character left. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character right. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Jump
VariableKeystroke.Description: Makes the character jump. (May require HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Most MMORPGs include an Auto-Follow feature, which is useful to move your characters together as a group.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select his target's target, such as to assist in combat against the same enemy. Most games include this feature.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select himself.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 1, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 2, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 3, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 4, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 5, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 6, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Interact with Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: While most MMORPGs require actually clicking with the mouse to perform the default 'right click' action, others including World of Warcraft provide a configurable Hotkey for the same capability.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Focus my Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Focus is a secondary target available in some games, to remain 'focused' on a target while still being able to click or otherwise select others.

ClickBar.Name: Broadcast
ClickBar.Description:
This defines the icons that you see by default in the upper left corner of the screen in-game. The left icon toggles Key Maps (such as auto-assisting Action Bar hotkeys), and the right icon toggles 1 to 1 broadcasting (Repeater) which is used for example to type the same password in all windows at the same time.
To move this and other Click Bars, bring up the in-game ISBoxer control panel by pressing the hotkey configured in your Character Set (Ctrl+Shift+Alt+G by default from the Quick Setup Wizard). All of ISBoxer's in-game UI will then have draggable title bars.

ClickBar.Name: Formations
ClickBar.Description: This is the default Formations Click Bar. It has icons for activating Flying V, 4-point Star, or Line formations, as defined in the General Key Map.
